SEARCH
Package com.example.chicksevent

Class TEST22_US010503_EntrantDeclineInvitationUITest

java.lang.Object
com.example.chicksevent.TEST22_US010503_EntrantDeclineInvitationUITest
public class TEST22_US010503_EntrantDeclineInvitationUITest extends Object
UI tests for US 01.05.03: As an entrant I want to be able to decline an invitation when chosen to participate in an event. These instrumented tests verify that:
  • Entrants can see the invitation status when they are invited to an event
  • Entrants can see the decline button when invited
  • Entrants can click the decline button to decline the invitation
  • UI updates correctly after declining (invitation status hidden, declined status shown)
  • Edge cases are handled (event on hold, etc.)
Note: For reliable test execution, it's recommended to disable animations on the test device/emulator before running these tests: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 0
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 0
To re-enable animations after testing: 
 adb shell settings put global animator_duration_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global window_animation_scale 1
 adb shell settings put global transition_animation_scale 1
Note: Full end-to-end testing requires:
  • Firebase test data with an event where the user has INVITED status
  • Navigation to EventDetailFragment with valid eventId
  • User profile setup for successful decline
These tests focus on UI element visibility and basic interactions.

    • waitForView

      private void waitForView(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher, int maxAttempts)
      Waits for a view to be displayed with retries. This helps handle timing issues with fragment lifecycle and view attachment.

    • waitForView

      private void waitForView(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher)
      Waits for a view to be displayed with default retries (10 attempts = 5 seconds).

    • inEventDetailFragment

      private org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> inEventDetailFragment(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher)
      Creates a matcher for a view that exists within EventDetailFragment. This ensures we match views only in EventDetailFragment, not in list items. Views in EventDetailFragment are descendants of scroll_content. First ensures scroll_content exists, then returns the matcher.

    • waitForViewInEventDetailFragment

      private void waitForViewInEventDetailFragment(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher, int maxAttempts)
      Waits for a view that's inside EventDetailFragment (descendant of scroll_content). This is safer than using inEventDetailFragment() directly with waitForView().

    • waitForViewInEventDetailFragment

      private void waitForViewInEventDetailFragment(org.hamcrest.Matcher<android.view.View> viewMatcher)

    • ensureOnEventDetailFragment

      private void ensureOnEventDetailFragment()
      Waits for EventDetailFragment to be loaded and verified. Uses scroll_content as the definitive check since it's unique to EventDetailFragment.

      Scrolls to a view to ensure it's visible on screen.

      Helper method to navigate to EventDetailFragment. Navigates: Events -> Click first event in list

      true if navigation succeeded, false otherwise

      Test Case 7: UI updates after declining invitation. As an entrant, after I decline the invitation, the invitation status should disappear and the declined status should be displayed.

      Test Case 12: Complete decline invitation flow works end-to-end. As an entrant, the complete flow of viewing event details when invited and declining the invitation should work correctly.

    • entrant_eventDetails_remainVisibleAfterDeclining

      public void entrant_eventDetails_remainVisibleAfterDeclining()
      Test Case 13: Event details remain visible after declining. As an entrant, after declining the invitation, I should still be able to see all event details.

    • entrant_multipleDeclines_prevented

      public void entrant_multipleDeclines_prevented()
      Test Case 14: Multiple declines are prevented. As an entrant, if I try to decline the invitation multiple times, the UI should prevent duplicate declines.
